lead_paragraph: The global Brent oil benchmark price fell to below $35 a barrel, the lowest level since the depths of the 2008-9 economic downturn, helping to push stock markets lower.
snippet: The global Brent oil benchmark price fell to below $35 a barrel, the lowest level since the depths of the 2008-9 economic downturn, helping to push stock markets lower.

headline.main: Oil Prices Decline More Than 5 Percent as Stockpiles Increase
headline.print_headline: Oil Prices Decline More Than 5 Percent as Stockpiles Increase

abstract: Oil prices plummet again by more than 5 percent as global stockpiles grow; benchmark price has fallen below $35 a barrel.
